article.description: Jerry Stackhouse scored 31 points, and Chucky Atkins added 24 to lead the Detroit Pistons to a 110-105 victory over the Charlotte Hornets on Friday night.
article.headline: Wallace free throws, Stack 3 seal victory
article.linkText: Stackhouse surges as Pistons nip Hornets
article.story:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Ben Wallace and Jerry Stackhouse made big shots in big spots for the Detroit Pistons. Wallace made two free throws to break a 103-103 tie with 1:04 left, and Stackhouse hit a 3-pointer with 15 seconds left to seal Detroit's 110-105 victory over the Charlotte Hornets on Friday night. "Fortunately, I was able to get some space and rise up and knock a big one down," said Stackhouse, who had 31 for the night. "It was a great win for us. The play of the game no doubt was when Ben stepped up and hit both free throws." Baron Davis had 23 points, and Lee Nailon and Elden Campbell added 17 each for the Hornets, who have lost five straight at home. Davis also tied his career high with 14 assists. With two 3-pointers from Bryce Drew and one from Davis, the Hornets opened the final period with a 17-9 run and took a 91-90 lead on Drew's 3 from the right corner with 7:22 remaining. The teams traded the lead five times until Campbell tied it at 98 on a pair of free throws with 3:07 left. Two baskets by reserve Corliss Williamson, who scored 19, gave Detroit a 102-98 lead with two minutes left, but Charlotte rallied to tie it at 103 on David Wesley's 3-pointer from the top of the key at 1:19. "It was just a fun basketball game," Williamson said. "Our mindset was a lot better tonight. We have guys coming off the bench capable of scoring and playing defense. When we're doing that, we almost can't be beat." Chucky Atkins added 24 for Detroit on 3-of-5 shooting from 3-point range. He had 13 points at the break and Stackhouse 11, as the Pistons closed the half with a 27-18 run after Charlotte took a 30-29 lead on Davis' jumper with 9:36 left. A 10-0 spurt in the first quarter gave the Hornets a 25-18 lead, but Atkins and Stackhouse each scored four points in an 8-0 run to tie it. Wesley had 13 points at the half, and Nailon, who continues to excel as a starter in place of injured Jamal Mashburn, added 10. "They're a good team, and we played them right down to the wire," Hornets coach Paul Silas said. "The second quarter was our undoing, but we came back strong in the last quarter and had a chance to win. That's all I can ask for."

Game notes
Wesley's wife Shannon gave birth to the couple's second child Thursday night. The 6-pound, 15-ounce baby girl is named Jada Wesley. ... In the five previous meetings between the teams, Stackhouse averaged 27.4 points per game. ... The Hornets have won 11 of their last 17 against Detroit, but have dropped four of the last six.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
